title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerContainer - Q0001
text: What does the 'Service Instance per Container' deployment pattern describe?

options.text: Running one service instance per container
Running multiple services in a single container
Running services directly on the host OS

explanation: This pattern deploys one service instance per container to ensure isolation and portability.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerContainer - Q0002
text: Which of the following is a key advantage of this pattern?
explanation: Containers provide lightweight isolation, allowing multiple services to run efficiently on the same host.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerContainer - Q0003
text: Which of the following technologies is commonly used for this pattern?
explanation: Docker is a popular containerization platform used to implement the Service Instance per Container pattern.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerContainer - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a benefit for scalability?

options.text: Containers can be started and stopped quickly

explanation: Containers start quickly, enabling fast horizontal scaling of microservices.

title: MicroservicesDeploymentServiceInstancePerContainer - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of this pattern?
explanation: Containers share the host OS kernel, providing weaker isolation than full virtual machines.
